cognito.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct authorization endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.
Please make sure if you have entered only allowed scopes in the plugin. Also, make sure those scopes are selected in Cognito. You verify this step from the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Redirect url in the Cognito Developer application from the plugin . You can refer to to this steps in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct client secret in the plugin. You can refer to this steps to configure correct client secret in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Token and User info endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.

To fix this issue, please check that the authorization code grant type is configured in the Cognito Developer application. You can configure the correct grant type with the help of this step in the setup guide.

azure.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct authorization endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct client ID in the plugin. You can refer to this steps to configure correct client ID in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct client secret in the plugin. You can refer to this steps to configure correct client secret in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the 'common' endpoints in the plugin or add user in the tenant . You can refer to the setup guide to configure the common endpoints.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Redirect url in the Azure AD Developer application from the plugin . You can refer to this step in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct client ID in the plugin. You can refer to this steps to configure correct client ID in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct client secret in the plugin. You can refer to this steps to configure correct client secret in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the 'common' endpoints in the plugin or add user in the tenant . You can refer to the setup guide to configure the common endpoints.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct tenant id in the plugin from Azure Developer app. You can configure the correct tenant id by following this steps from the setup guide.

To fix this issue, you need to change the Support Account Type in Azure Developer app as per the microsoft accounts to be allowed to perform SSO. You can refer to this steps to select the correct Support Account Type.

discord.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct client ID in the plugin. You can refer to this steps to configure correct client ID in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct client secret in the plugin. You can refer to this steps to configure correct client secret in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Redirect url in the Discord Developer application from the plugin . You can refer to this step in the setup guide.
This error is shown when scope is not configured in the plugin. Please configure the scope in the plugin using this setup guide.
Please make sure if you have entered only allowed scopes in the plugin. Also, make sure those scopes are selected in Discord. You can verify the step from this setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Token and User info endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.

keycloak.error: We are sorry... Page not found
keycloak.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct domain and realm in authorization endpoint in the plugin. You can refer to this steps to configure correct endpoints in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct realm in token endpoint in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct realm in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct client secret in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct client secret in the setup guide.

keycloak.error: There has been a critical error on this website.
keycloak.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct domain in authorization endpoint in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct domain in the setup guide.
Please make sure if you have entered only allowed scopes in the plugin. Also, make sure those scopes are selected in Keycloak devapp. You can verify the step from this setup guide.

azureb2c.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct scope in the plugin and verify whether these claims are configured in the Azure AD B2C Developer application. You can refer to this step in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please check whether you have configured the correct Redirect url in the Azure AD B2C Developer application from the plugin . You can refer to this step in the setup guide.
This error is shown when scope is not configured in the plugin. Please configure the scope in the plugin using this setup guide.
Please make sure if you have entered the correct scopes in the plugin. Also, make sure those scopes are selected in Azure. You can verify the step from this setup guide.

This issue occurs when wrong client secret is configured or client secret is expired. To fix this issue, please configure the correct client secret in the plugin. You refer this step from the setup guide.

azureb2c.error: The resource you are looking for has been removed, had its name changed, or is temporarily unavailable.
azureb2c.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct tenant name and policy in the authorization endpoint in the plugin . You can refer to this step for tenant and this step for policy in the setup guide.

azureb2c.error: Response :The resource you are looking for has been removed, had its name changed, or is temporarily unavailable.        Invalid response received.
azureb2c.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct tenant name and policy in the Token endpoint in the plugin . You can refer to this step for tenant and this step for policy in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Redirect url in the Azure B2C Developer application from the plugin . You can refer to this step in the setup guide.

okta.error: 400 Bad Request Your request resulted in an error.
okta.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct client ID and Okta domain in authorization endpoint in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct client ID and this step to configure correct Okta domain in the setup guide.

okta.error: The client secret supplied for a confidential client is invalid.
okta.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct client secret in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct client secret in the setup guide.
This error is shown when scope is not configured in the plugin. Please configure the scope in the plugin using this setup guide.
Please make sure if you have entered only allowed scopes in the plugin. Also, make sure those scopes are selected in Okta. You can verify the step from this setup guide.

okta.error: our request resulted in an error. The 'redirect_uri' parameter must be a Login redirect URI in the client app settings
okta.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct Redirect url in the Okta Developer application from the plugin . You can refer to this step in the setup guide.

okta.error: Cannot supply multiple client credentials. Use one of the following: credentials in the Authorization header, credentials in the post body, or a client_assertion in the post body.
okta.desc: To fix this issue, please make sure that you choose only one option in the checkbox labeled 'Send Client Credentials' in the plugin . You can refer to this step in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Okta domain in authorization endpoint in the plugin. You refer to this step to configure correct Okta domain in the setup guide.

okta.error: User is not assigned to the client application.
okta.desc: To fix this issue, please assign the okta sso application to the user facing this error. You can refer to to this step to assign the okta application to that user.

gapps.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct Client ID in the plugin. You can refer to this steps to configure correct client ID in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Client Secret in the plugin. You refer to this steps to configure correct client secret in the setup guide.

gapps.error: The requested URL was not found on this server. That’s all we know.
gapps.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct authorization endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.

gapps.error: The requested URL /sample-url was not found on this server. That’s all we know.
gapps.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct token endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.
To fix this issue, please change the Google developer application to External type. You can refer to this step in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Redirect url in the Google Developer application from the plugin . You can refer to this steps in the setup guide.

salesforce.desc: This error occurs when you decline the user consent form after entering your credentials in the Salesforce login form. To resolve this, you can simply accept the consent form the next time you attempt to perform Test Configuration or initiate Single Sign-On (SSO).

This error occurs when either the Client Secret is invalid or the Get User Info Endpoint is not valid. To confirm the client secret, please follow this step. Additionally, to check the validity of the Get User Info endpoint, please refer to this step.
This error occurs when the Client ID is configured incorrectly. To confirm the client ID, please follow this step.
This error occurs when an incorrect Callback URL is configured in the Salesforce application. To resolve this issue, please refer to the this step to enter the correct Callback URL.

salesforce.error: OAUTH_APPROVAL_ERROR_GENERIC : An unexpected error has occured during authentication. Please try again.
salesforce.desc: This error occurs when the correct scopes are not configured in the plugin or Salesforce application. You can refer to this step to configure the appropriate scopes in the plugin or Salesforce application.

This error occurs when the authorization endpoint or token endpoint is not configured correctly. To confirm the endpoints, please refer to these steps. Additionally, ensure that you have correctly configured the Salesforce domain to avoid any potential issues.

classlink.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct client secret in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct client secret in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct scope in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct scope in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct client ID in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct client ID in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Token and User info endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.

onelogin.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct client ID in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct client ID in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct client secret in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct client secret in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct scope in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct scope in the setup guide.

onelogin.error: 410 Gone The resource is no longer available and will not be available again.
onelogin.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct authorization and token endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.

onelogin.error: client authentication must only be provided using one mechanism
onelogin.desc: To fix this issue, please make sure that you choose only Header option in the checkbox labeled Send Client Credentials in the plugin . You can refer to this step in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct Redirect url in the OneLogin Developer application from the plugin . You can refer to this step in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct site-url in authorization and token endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.

auth0.error: There could be a misconfiguration in the system or a service outage. We track these errors automatically, but if the problem persists feel free to contact us.Please try again.
auth0.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct client ID in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct client ID in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct client secret in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct client secret in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct scope in the plugin. You can refer to this step to configure correct scope in the setup guide.
To fix this issue, please configure the correct domain in authorization endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.

auth0.error: Response : Not Found Invalid response received.
auth0.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct domain in token endpoint in the plugin. You can confirm the correct format of the endpoint from HERE.

auth0.error: Callback URL mismatch. The provided redirect_uri is not in the list of allowed callback URLs.
auth0.desc: To fix this issue, please configure the correct Redirect url in the Auth0 Developer application from the plugin . You can refer to this step in the setup guide.
